Biology_54.News Finding: Contrary to common hypotheses, they found that the most likely origin of migration in this group lay in ancestral species that resided in North America and gradually moved further and further south for the winter.
Biology_54.Paper Finding: Contrary to expectations, we found that long-distance migration primarily evolved through evolutionary shifts of geographic range south for the winter out of North America, as opposed to north for the summer.
Biology_54.News Context: Their work also offers evidence that many tropical bird species descended from migratory ancestors that lost migration. Contrary to common hypotheses, they found that the most likely origin of migration in this group lay in ancestral species that resided in North America and gradually moved further and further south for the winter. Shifts in range from North America to tropical areas were the dominant pathway for geographical change, and evolved much more frequently than shifts northward from tropical areas.
Biology_54.Paper Context: These results illuminate how the evolution of seasonal migration has contributed to greater niche conservatism among tropical members of this diverse avian radiation. Contrary to expectations, we found that long-distance migration primarily evolved through evolutionary shifts of geographic range south for the winter out of North America, as opposed to north for the summer. Our results further suggest that seasonal migration promoted colonization of the tropics from North America.
Biology_54.text:
['Finding A: Contrary to common hypotheses, they found that the most likely origin of migration in this group lay in ancestral species that resided in North America and gradually moved further and further south for the winter.
Finding B: Contrary to expectations, we found that long-distance migration primarily evolved through evolutionary shifts of geographic range south for the winter out of North America, as opposed to north for the summer.']
Biology_54.displayed_text:
Finding A: Contrary to common hypotheses, they found that the most likely origin of migration in this group lay in ancestral species that resided in North America and gradually moved further and further south for the winter.
Finding B: Contrary to expectations, we found that long-distance migration primarily evolved through evolutionary shifts of geographic range south for the winter out of North America, as opposed to north for the summer.

Biology_tweet_58.News Finding: A paper @username looks at APC's tumor suppressor role in colonic crypts in light of the tissue architecture  #OA
Biology_tweet_58.Paper Finding: Our results reveal a tumor suppressing function arising from the interactions between dynamic subcellular APC network and the adhesion gradient in the crypt, which promotes the elimination of mutant cells with high Wnt signaling.
Biology_tweet_58.News Context: A paper @username looks at APC's tumor suppressor role in colonic crypts in light of the tissue architecture  #OA
Biology_tweet_58.Paper Context: This observation suggests that the effects of mutations are modulated by a dynamic competition between tumor promoting and suppressive forces that may depend on the signaling status of individual cells and their local microenvironment. Our results reveal a tumor suppressing function arising from the interactions between dynamic subcellular APC network and the adhesion gradient in the crypt, which promotes the elimination of mutant cells with high Wnt signaling. Subversion of these interactions permits mutant cells to persist in the crypt and initiate CRC.
Biology_tweet_58.text:
['Finding A: A paper @username looks at APC\'s tumor suppressor role in colonic crypts in light of the tissue architecture #OA
Finding B: Our results reveal a tumor suppressing function arising from the interactions between dynamic subcellular APC network and the adhesion gradient in the crypt, which promotes the elimination of mutant cells with high Wnt signaling.']
Biology_tweet_58.displayed_text:
Finding A: A paper @username looks at APC's tumor suppressor role in colonic crypts in light of the tissue architecture #OA
Finding B: Our results reveal a tumor suppressing function arising from the interactions between dynamic subcellular APC network and the adhesion gradient in the crypt, which promotes the elimination of mutant cells with high Wnt signaling.

Biology_194.News Finding: The first is that ancestors of migratory birds spent the whole year in North America and evolved migration by moving their winter range to the tropics.
Biology_194.Paper Finding: Our results further suggest that seasonal migration promoted colonization of the tropics from North America.
Biology_194.News Context: The first is that ancestors of migratory birds spent the whole year in North America and evolved migration by moving their winter range to the tropics. Eventually, they found that more evidence supported the idea that birds once lived year-round in North America and eventually began migrating further and further south, resulting in today's migrations. This also suggests that many tropical species of birds are descendants of migratory ancestors that lost migration and stayed in the tropics.
Biology_194.Paper Context: Contrary to expectations, we found that long-distance migration primarily evolved through evolutionary shifts of geographic range south for the winter out of North America, as opposed to north for the summer. Our results further suggest that seasonal migration promoted colonization of the tropics from North America. We found that seasonal migration between breeding ranges in North America and winter ranges in the Neotropics evolved primarily via shifts of winter ranges toward the tropics from ancestral ranges in North America.
Biology_194.text:
['Finding A: The first is that ancestors of migratory birds spent the whole year in North America and evolved migration by moving their winter range to the tropics.
Finding B: Our results further suggest that seasonal migration promoted colonization of the tropics from North America.']
Biology_194.displayed_text:
Finding A: The first is that ancestors of migratory birds spent the whole year in North America and evolved migration by moving their winter range to the tropics.
Finding B: Our results further suggest that seasonal migration promoted colonization of the tropics from North America.

Biology_tweet_228.News Finding: Could liver SIRT1 play a key role in #obesity ? This paper certainly suggests so:
Biology_tweet_228.Paper Finding: Body composition analysis showed that SIRT1 LKO mice had increased fat mass without changed lean mass.
Biology_tweet_228.News Context: Could liver SIRT1 play a key role in #obesity ? This paper certainly suggests so:
Biology_tweet_228.Paper Context: SIRT1 LKO mice appeared to have increased adiposity with more visible fat, possibly due to increased adipocyte cell size. Body composition analysis showed that SIRT1 LKO mice had increased fat mass without changed lean mass. Daily food intake was similar between WT and SIRT1 LKO mice on a regular chow diet.
Biology_tweet_228.text:
['Finding A: Could liver SIRT1 play a key role in #obesity ? This paper certainly suggests so:
Finding B: Body composition analysis showed that SIRT1 LKO mice had increased fat mass without changed lean mass.']
Biology_tweet_228.displayed_text:
Finding A: Could liver SIRT1 play a key role in #obesity ? This paper certainly suggests so:
Finding B: Body composition analysis showed that SIRT1 LKO mice had increased fat mass without changed lean mass.

Biology_236.News Finding: They found that infected areas in patients with bacterial skin infections also showed remarkably high salt accumulation.
Biology_236.Paper Finding: We found that Na + accumulated at the site of bacterial skin infections in humans and in mice.
Biology_236.News Context: A clue to this mystery came when Titze and his collaborators noticed an unusually high amount of sodium in the infected skin of mice that had been bitten by cage mates. They found that infected areas in patients with bacterial skin infections also showed remarkably high salt accumulation. Moving forward, the researchers will examine how salt accumulates in the skin and triggers immune responses, and why salt accumulates in the skin of aging adults.
Biology_236.Paper Context: We found that Na + accumulated at the site of bacterial skin infections in humans and in mice. Activation of macrophages in the presence of high NaCl concentrations modified epigenetic markers and enhanced p38 mitogen-activated protein kinase (p38/MAPK)-dependent nuclear factor of activated T cells 5 (NFAT5) activation. This high-salt response resulted in elevated type-2 nitric oxide synthase (Nos2)-dependent NO production and improved Leishmania major control.
Biology_236.text:
['Finding A: They found that infected areas in patients with bacterial skin infections also showed remarkably high salt accumulation.
Finding B: We found that Na + accumulated at the site of bacterial skin infections in humans and in mice.']
Biology_236.displayed_text:
Finding A: They found that infected areas in patients with bacterial skin infections also showed remarkably high salt accumulation.
Finding B: We found that Na + accumulated at the site of bacterial skin infections in humans and in mice.

Biology_tweet_30.News Finding: Factor XIIIA-Expressing Inflammatory Monocytes Promote Lung Squamous Cancer through Fibrin Cross-Linking @username @username @username
Biology_tweet_30.Paper Finding: Notably, we show that IMs highly express Factor XIIIA, which promotes fibrin cross-linking to create a scaffold for LUSC cell invasion and metastases.
Biology_tweet_30.News Context: Factor XIIIA-Expressing Inflammatory Monocytes Promote Lung Squamous Cancer through Fibrin Cross-Linking @username @username @username
Biology_tweet_30.Paper Context: Pharmacologic inhibition of IM recruitment had substantial anti-metastatic effects. Notably, we show that IMs highly express Factor XIIIA, which promotes fibrin cross-linking to create a scaffold for LUSC cell invasion and metastases. Consistently, human LUSC samples containing extensive crosslinked fibrin in the microenvironment correlated with poor survival.

Biology_33.News Finding: The results of the study showed that the regeneration process was most advanced when BMP2 was applied first, with BMP9 added a week after - in this case it led to the growth of more complete joint structures, even with some connections to the bone.
Biology_33.Paper Finding: Combining BMP2 and BMP9 treatments in sequence stimulates the regeneration of bone and joint.
Biology_33.News Context: "These studies provide evidence that treatment of growth factors can be used to engineer a regeneration response from a non-regenerating amputation wound," explain the researchers in their paper. The results of the study showed that the regeneration process was most advanced when BMP2 was applied first, with BMP9 added a week after - in this case it led to the growth of more complete joint structures, even with some connections to the bone. Humans are similar to mice in terms of the way our skeletons fit together, so this is possibly something that could be transferred over.
Biology_33.Paper Context: Regenerated structures include a skeletal element lined with articular cartilage and a synovial cavity, and we demonstrate that this response requires the Prg4 gene. Combining BMP2 and BMP9 treatments in sequence stimulates the regeneration of bone and joint. These studies provide evidence that treatment of growth factors can be used to engineer a regeneration response from a non-regenerating amputation wound.
Biology_33.text:
['Finding A: The results of the study showed that the regeneration process was most advanced when BMP2 was applied first, with BMP9 added a week after - in this case it led to the growth of more complete joint structures, even with some connections to the bone.
Finding B: Combining BMP2 and BMP9 treatments in sequence stimulates the regeneration of bone and joint.']
Biology_33.displayed_text:
Finding A: The results of the study showed that the regeneration process was most advanced when BMP2 was applied first, with BMP9 added a week after - in this case it led to the growth of more complete joint structures, even with some connections to the bone.
Finding B: Combining BMP2 and BMP9 treatments in sequence stimulates the regeneration of bone and joint.

Biology_253.News Finding: The BioBits kits introduce molecular and synthetic biology concepts without the need for specialized lab equipment, at a fraction of the cost of current standard experimental designs.
Biology_253.Paper Finding: Our custom imagers and incubators are included in BioBits™ Bright, making reaction analysis accessible for resourcelimited classrooms.
Biology_253.News Context: The BioBits kits introduce molecular and synthetic biology concepts without the need for specialized lab equipment, at a fraction of the cost of current standard experimental designs. The FD-CF reactions pioneered in Collins' lab for molecular manufacturing, when combined with innovations from the lab of Michael Jewett, Ph.D. at Northwestern University, offer a solution to this problem by removing bacteria from the equation altogether. "Challenging the students to build their own in vitro synthetic programs also allows educators to start to talk about how synthetic biologists might control biology to make important products, such as medicines or chemicals," explained Jessica Stark, an NSF Graduate Research Fellow in the Jewett lab at Northwestern University who is co-first author on both papers.
Biology_253.Paper Context: This is made possible by our in-house freeze-dried reactions, which are two orders of magnitude more affordable than existing commercial cell-free kits, at just ~US$0.01 per microliter of reaction volume (table S3) compared to ~US$1 per microliter (Promega L110; NEB E6800S). Our custom imagers and incubators are included in BioBits™ Bright, making reaction analysis accessible for resourcelimited classrooms. Because of the highly portable, cost-effective, and user-friendly nature of the reagents and laboratory activities, the BioBits™ Bright and Explorer kits have utility both inside and outside of a formal classroom or laboratory setting.
Biology_253.text:
['Finding A: The BioBits kits introduce molecular and synthetic biology concepts without the need for specialized lab equipment, at a fraction of the cost of current standard experimental designs.
Finding B: Our custom imagers and incubators are included in BioBits™ Bright, making reaction analysis accessible for resourcelimited classrooms.']
Biology_253.displayed_text:
Finding A: The BioBits kits introduce molecular and synthetic biology concepts without the need for specialized lab equipment, at a fraction of the cost of current standard experimental designs.
Finding B: Our custom imagers and incubators are included in BioBits™ Bright, making reaction analysis accessible for resourcelimited classrooms.

Biology_100.News Finding: When the team administered small doses of androgens to mice that were taking the equivalent of medications given to women undergoing IVF therapy, they developed more mature, egg-containing follicles than mice that didn't receive androgens.
Biology_100.Paper Finding: Finally, we report that low doses of exogenous androgens enhance gonadotropin-induced ovulation in mice, further demonstrating the critical role that androgens play in follicular development and fertility.
Biology_100.News Context: "Androgens are increasing follicle growth and ensuring follicles don't die -- exactly what you want when providing fertility treatment," noted Hammes, who is also the chief of the Division of Endocrinology and Metabolism at UR Medicine's Strong Memorial Hospital. When the team administered small doses of androgens to mice that were taking the equivalent of medications given to women undergoing IVF therapy, they developed more mature, egg-containing follicles than mice that didn't receive androgens. The androgen-treated female mice also released larger numbers of eggs with ovulation.
Biology_100.Paper Context: Interestingly, we find that the scaffold molecule paxillin regulates both processes, making it a critical regulator of AR actions in the ovary. Finally, we report that low doses of exogenous androgens enhance gonadotropin-induced ovulation in mice, further demonstrating the critical role that androgens play in follicular development and fertility. These data may explain reported positive effects of androgens on ovulation rates in women with diminished ovarian reserve.
Biology_100.text:
['Finding A: When the team administered small doses of androgens to mice that were taking the equivalent of medications given to women undergoing IVF therapy, they developed more mature, egg-containing follicles than mice that didn\'t receive androgens.
Finding B: Finally, we report that low doses of exogenous androgens enhance gonadotropin-induced ovulation in mice, further demonstrating the critical role that androgens play in follicular development and fertility.']
Biology_100.displayed_text:
Finding A: When the team administered small doses of androgens to mice that were taking the equivalent of medications given to women undergoing IVF therapy, they developed more mature, egg-containing follicles than mice that didn't receive androgens.
Finding B: Finally, we report that low doses of exogenous androgens enhance gonadotropin-induced ovulation in mice, further demonstrating the critical role that androgens play in follicular development and fertility.

Biology_tweet_158.News Finding: Facial colour in women tracks their estradiol levels, gives information about reproductive cycle
Biology_tweet_158.Paper Finding: Estradiol may increase blood flow to blood vessels close to the surface of the skin, increasing skin redness .
Biology_tweet_158.News Context: Facial colour in women tracks their estradiol levels, gives information about reproductive cycle
Biology_tweet_158.Paper Context: For example, female rhesus macaques' ) and mandrills' facial skin becomes redder during the fertile phase of their ovarian cycles, complementing findings for similar changes in the color of female hindquarter skin also become darker during the fertile phase of their ovarian cycles ( . Estradiol may increase blood flow to blood vessels close to the surface of the skin, increasing skin redness . For example, increasing red, yellow, and light skin coloration increases the perceived health of white European and black African women's faces Re et al., 2011) .

['Finding A: Facial colour in women tracks their estradiol levels, gives information about reproductive cycle
Finding B: Estradiol may increase blood flow to blood vessels close to the surface of the skin, increasing skin redness .']

Biology_tweet_48.News Finding: Leaves suck? Yield boost in soybean seen by cutting leaves off.
Biology_tweet_48.Paper Finding: The predicted gains in yield were primarily due to decreased investment in leaves allowing predicted increase in seed production.
Biology_tweet_48.News Context: Leaves suck? Yield boost in soybean seen by cutting leaves off.
Biology_tweet_48.Paper Context: The model therefore predicts that the additional two units of LAI above the model predicted optimum would not significantly contribute to net carbon gain, as photosynthesis roughly compensated for respiratory costs (Fig. The predicted gains in yield were primarily due to decreased investment in leaves allowing predicted increase in seed production. However, as LAI is lowered below the optimum value, predicted losses in NPP become significant to the detriment of seed production.

['Finding A: Leaves suck? Yield boost in soybean seen by cutting leaves off.
Finding B: The predicted gains in yield were primarily due to decreased investment in leaves allowing predicted increase in seed production.']
